text: Metal cappings installed over parapets and enclosed balustrades, shall be as outlined in Paragraphs 6.0 and 7.4, and comply with the following requirements: a) Tops of cappings shall be free of any penetrations, b) Slope of top shall be 5° (1:12) minimum, c) The cover at the sides of the capping shall be in accordance with Table 7, d) All cappings shall have drip edges. e) Cappings shall be separated from underlying timber by roof underlay as shown in Figure 10.

text: 6.1.1 All sections of the drainage system shall be tested by water test or air test to ensure watertightness.

text: 3.0 Solar Water Heater Requirements; Collectors installed in climate zone 3 (as shown in Figure 1) must: a) pass the level 2 test described in AS/NZS 2712 Appendix E, or have an automatic drain-down system.
spaced_lrml: if( is( solar collector. location, climate zone 3)), then( obligation( or( and( test( solar collector, level 2 test), as per( level 2 test, nzs 2712 appendix e)), has( solar collector, automatic draindown system))))

text: 5.3.2 Pipes must be installed and supported to permit thermal movement, except where anchor points are necessary.
spaced_lrml: if( not( is( pipe. anchor point, necessary))), then( obligation( and( include( pipe. installation, thermal movement), include( pipe. support, thermal movement))))

text: Hidden, valley and internal gutters shall be in accordance with Paragraph 8.1.6.

text: Covers to water tanks shall be removable or shall contain a covered opening to allow access for inspection and maintenance. A minimum height clearance of 350 mm above the opening is necessary for easy access.
spaced_lrml: if( has( water tank, cover)), then( obligation( or( is( cover, removable), and( has( cover, covered opening), above( covered opening, height clearance), greater than equal( height clearance, 350 mm)))))

text: 3.4.6 All backflow prevention devices must be testable in service to verify effective performance.
spaced_lrml: if( exist( backflow prevention device)), then( obligation( is( backflow prevention device, testable in service)))

text: 5.1.1 Where water is heated by a wetback water heater and a solar collector, independent water pipe circuits must be installed for each heat source.
spaced_lrml: if( is( water heater, and( wetback water heater, solar collector))), then( obligation( and( define( solar collector. water pipe circuit, x0), not( equal( wetback water heater. water pipe circuit, x0)))))

spaced_lrml: if( exist( solar water heater)), then( obligation( comply with( solar water heater, nzbc g12as1)))

text: 5.2.10 Acetic cured silicone sealants may be used with stainless steel but must not be used on zinc or aluminium-zinc coatings.

spaced_lrml: if( has( solar water heater, controller)), then( obligation( comply with( controller, 'nzs 2712 6.3')))

text: Flashings are required to shed or divert water at sensitive areas of the building cladding. These include at: a) The building periphery, except where gutters are present, b) Changes of direction in cladding materials, c) Intersections between cladding materials or with other buildings, and d) Roof or wall penetrations, including windows, doors and other penetrations.
spaced_lrml: if( and( has( building, cladding), or( is( cladding. area, sensitive), and( is( cladding. area, building periphery), not( within( cladding. area, gutter))), and( has( cladding. area, material), has( material, change in direction)), and( has( cladding. area, intersection), or( has( cladding, materials), in between( intersection, materials), towards( intersection, other building))), has( cladding. area, or( penetration, window, door))))), then( obligation( and( has( cladding. area, flashing), for( flashing, or( shed water, divert water)))))

text: Drainage 3.3.1 All gully traps shall be constructed to prevent the ingress of surface water and foreign bodies likely to cause a blockage, shall be located within the legal boundary of the land on which the building is erected.
spaced_lrml: if( exist( gully trap)), then( obligation( and( prevent( gully trap, ingress), for( ingress, and( surface water, foreign bodies)), within( gully trap. location, site boundary))))

text: Physical testing of glass barriers must include all components of the barrier system, including all structural connections. Loads and deflections must be applied and measured horizontally, at midspan, at the required barrier height. The concentrated load shall be applied over an area of 100 mm x 100 mm and for at least one minute.

text: Aluminium-zinc-magnesium coated steel shall: a) have a BMT of 0.55 mm minimum b) be grade G550, or G300 for curved or crimped flashings c) be selected for corrosion protection according to the intended exposure zone as shown in Table 20.

spaced_lrml: if( part of( access route, escape route)), then( obligation( comply with( access route, nzbc c4)))

text: 8.0 Roof; Hips, ridges, valleys and barges shall be made weathertight by using flashings and seals as shown in Figure 23 to Figure 28.

text: 1.1.1 The scope of this Acceptable Solution is restricted to all risk groups listed in Table 1.1 except for risk group SH (refer to C/AS1).

text: 3.1.2 The components of an escape route, in ascending order of protection, are the: a) Open paths, and b) Exitways, and c) Final exits (see Figure 3.1). Two or more of these components will be necessary.

text: Specific design for preventing the ingress of snow melt water is required when the open ground snow load Sg, as defined in NZS 3604, exceeds 1.0 kPa, and the roof is constructed in a way that is likely to cause a build-up of snow.

text: the fire safety systems required for firecells in early childhood centres shall be as follows: Where the escape height of the early childhood centre is greater than 2.0 m, a Type 7 system shall be installed throughout the building.

text: Joins of metal flashings shall have the following features: f) When using uncoated or coated lead flashings, maximum continuous lengths shall be 1300 mm for 17 kg or 1500 mm for 20 kg lead. Where the pitch of the flashing is greater than 15° at the join, the lap at the join shall be 100 mm minimum. Where the pitch of the flashing is 15° or less at the join, the lap at the join shall be 200 mm minimum and the flashing underneath the lap shall have a hook at the edge,.

text: 8.0 Roof Claddings 8.3 Pressed Metal Tiles 8.3.4.3 Aluminium; Aluminium for the manufacture of pressed metal tiles and flashing systems shall comply with AS/NZS 1734, and shall: a) Have a base metal thickness (BMT) of 0.7 mm minimum, b) Be minimum 5000 series, c) For pre-painted aluminium, have a factory-applied finish complying with AS/NZS 2728.

text: 3.9.2 Bedding and backfilling; Figure 13 gives acceptable solutions for the bedding and backfilling of the drainage pipes listed in Table 1 except where: a) The trench is located within or above peat, or b) Scouring of the trench is likely due to unstable soils, or d) The cover H to the pipe is more than 2.5 m.

text: 1.4 Calculating occupant loads 1.4.3 Duplication shall be avoided by: Not including an occupant load for exitways, or for the occupant load determined for areas such as lift lobbies or sanitary facilities that are used intermittently by people already counted elsewhere in the building.
